definition: to come to a stand/to stop
to stop/to halt/to park (a car)
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Tears stream down my cheeks, still, I don't stop.
sentences.chinese: 眼泪仍然不断淌下脸颊，我却并未停步。
他将在山脚步下停步不前。

sentences.english: The foal balked at the high stone fence.
sentences.chinese: 在高高的石围墙面前小马驹停步不前。

sentences.english: Before the door of the headmaster's office,she stopped and re-collected herself for a while.
sentences.chinese: 在校长办公室门前，她停步片刻使自己镇静下来。

sentences.english: Labor competition does not stop, A Good indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 劳动竞赛不停步，创先争优无止境。

sentences.english: But the LCD has not stopped there.
sentences.chinese: 但液晶显示器的发展并没有就此停步。

sentences.english: Tomasson doesn't want to stop now.
sentences.chinese: 现在托马森还不想停步。

sentences.english: He faltered and finally stopped in midstride.
sentences.chinese: 他退缩了，最终停步不前。

sentences.english: The suite, not foreseeing this halt, could not help pressing up closer to him.
sentences.chinese: 侍从们没有预见到他会停步，不由地朝地拥上来。

definition: to stop/to halt/to cease
(literary) to move forward
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to stop
to stand
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
at a fast pace
facing forwards
to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to reply/to answer
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to speed along
to come close/to get near to/front
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
